item.title: AWS Weekly Roundup: Amazon EC2, Amazon Q Developer, IPv6 updates, and more (September 1, 2025)
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üìÖ This week, the AWS Heroes Summit in Seattle highlighted the contributions of the AWS Heroes community. These exceptional individuals share their expertise through content creation, speaking, and open-source projects. ü§ù The summit provided a platform for networking and collaboration, with discussions on AWS roadmaps and direct feedback opportunities to AWS service teams. üöÄ Notable launches included IPv6 support for AWS App Runner, AWS Client VPN, and RDS Data API, enhancing connectivity‚Ä¶

item.title: New general-purpose Amazon EC2 M8i and M8i Flex instances are now available
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ Exciting news for cloud users! Amazon has launched the M8i and M8i-Flex EC2 instances powered by Intel Xeon processors. These new instances offer up to 15% better price performance and 20% higher performance than previous generations. They‚Äôre designed for general workloads like web applications, databases, and AI models. M8i instances also provide enhanced network and EBS bandwidth, improving performance across various applications. #AmazonEC2 #CloudComputing #TechUpdates #AWS #IntelXeon

Source: AWS Blog
Author: Channy Yun (Ïú§ÏÑùÏ∞¨)
Category: product_announcements

item.title: AWS services scale to new heights for Prime Day 2025: key metrics and milestones
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ Amazon Prime Day 2025 set new sales records, driven by enhanced AI features and AWS infrastructure. Prime members enjoyed billions in savings, utilizing tools like Alexa+ and AI Shopping Guides for a seamless shopping experience. Key AWS metrics include 1.7 trillion Lambda invocations and a 160% increase in robot commands, showcasing massive scalability. #AmazonPrimeDay #AWS #AIShopping #Ecommerce #TechInnovation

Source: AWS Blog
Author: Channy Yun (Ïú§ÏÑùÏ∞¨)
Category: industry_analysis

item.title: AWS Weekly Roundup: Amazon Aurora 10th anniversary, Amazon EC2 R8 instances, Amazon Bedrock and more (August 25, 2025)
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üåü Exciting week in AWS! Amazon Aurora celebrates 10 years of innovation, revolutionizing database technology with features like serverless capabilities and generative AI support. üéâ New AWS launches include customizable dashboards in Billing and Cost Management, and enhanced access to OpenAI models through Amazon Bedrock. Check out the latest advancements! üöÄ #AWS #AmazonAurora #CloudComputing #DatabaseInnovation #OpenAI

Source: AWS Blog

item.title: Best performance and fastest memory with the new Amazon EC2 R8i and R8i-flex instances
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ Amazon has launched the new R8i and R8i-flex instances, optimized for memory and powered by Intel Xeon processors. These instances offer 15% better price performance, 20% higher performance, and 2.5 times more memory throughput than previous generations. Ideal for memory-intensive workloads like SQL databases and real-time analytics, R8i instances scale up to 96xlarge with impressive capabilities for various applications. Check it out! üíªüîç #AmazonEC2 #CloudComputing #IntelXeon‚Ä¶

Source: AWS Blog
Author: Veliswa Boya
Category: product_announcements

item.title: AWS Weekly Roundup: Single GPU P5 instances, Advanced Go Driver, Amazon SageMaker HyperPod and more (August 18, 2025)
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ Exciting updates from AWS this week! The upcoming BeSA (Become a Solutions Architect) cohort starts on September 6, offering free mentoring to enhance cloud careers. Learn more on the BeSA website. New launches include: - Amazon EC2 Single GPU P5 instances for cost-effective ML and HPC. - AWS Advanced Go Driver for improved database performance. - Enhanced Cilium support for Amazon EKS Hybrid Nodes. For AI enthusiasts, Amazon SageMaker HyperPod now supports advanced features‚Ä¶

Source: AWS Blog
Author: Prasad Rao
Category: product_announcements

item.title: AWS named as a Leader in 2025 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Strategic Cloud Platform Services for 15 years in a row
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üéâ AWS has been named a Leader in the 2025 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Strategic Cloud Platform Services for the 15th year in a row! Gartner recognized AWS for its strong ‚ÄúAbility to Execute,‚Äù highlighting its commitment to delivering extensive capabilities, security, and performance for critical applications. AWS boasts the largest global cloud community, custom silicon designs, and a robust network of integration partners, all contributing to successful cloud adoption. Explore the AWS Builder‚Ä¶

Source: AWS Blog
Author: Channy Yun (Ïú§ÏÑùÏ∞¨)

item.title: Celebrating 10 years of Amazon Aurora innovation
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üéâ Celebrating 10 years of Amazon Aurora! Join us for a livestream event on August 21, 2025, marking a decade of innovation in database technology. Amazon Aurora revolutionized the industry with its unique architecture, offering high performance and 99.99% availability at a fraction of the cost. Key milestones include the launch in 2015, the introduction of serverless capabilities in 2018, and ongoing enhancements focused on security, scalability, and cost management. #AmazonAurora‚Ä¶

Source: AWS Blog
Author: S√©bastien Stormacq
Category: product_announcements

item.title: Meet our newest AWS Heroes ‚Äî August 2025

item.description:
üöÄ Exciting news! We proudly introduce the latest cohort of AWS Heroes for August 2025. These individuals are recognized for their outstanding contributions to the AWS community. üåç From AI and machine learning to serverless architectures, they bring diverse expertise and a strong commitment to knowledge sharing. Join us in welcoming Kristine Armiyants, Nadia Reyhani, and Raphael Manke, who are shaping the future of cloud computing and inspiring the next generation! üí° #AWSHeroes #CloudComputing‚Ä¶

item.title: AWS Weekly Roundup: OpenAI models, Automated Reasoning checks, Amazon EVS, and more (August 11, 2025)
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üåç AWS Summits in Mexico City and Jakarta brought together the community for learning and networking. üöÄ Key highlights include the availability of OpenAI models on AWS, which excel in coding and analysis. üõ†Ô∏è The new Amazon Elastic VMware Service allows running VMware environments in Amazon VPC. üîç Automated Reasoning checks are now available to validate content accuracy from AI models. üìà Additional updates include expanded Amazon SQS message sizes and AWS Lambda support for GitHub Actions. #AWS‚Ä¶
